The device or component failed due to fluctuations within the power supply (e.g. transient power, power spike, power dip, or power sequencing).
Problems that are related to the device that provides power.
A device that fails when the system designed to ensure its safe operation fails.
Device problems that result from the failure to maintain or establish techniques for controlling and verifying the product specifications identified by the manufacturer.
An unacceptable or unexpected RF-induced temperature rise in the vicinity of a medical device or body part (usually caused by a closed current loop).

A device that experienced problems due to radiofrequency interference. RFI is a disturbance that affects an electrical circuit due to either electromagnetic conduction or electromagnetic radiation emitted from an external source.
Problems that occur with devices used for radiographic or imaging procedures e.g. CT scanners, magnetic resonance imaging, etc.
A device problem related to how the materials react inappropriately (e.g. over-react or under-react).
The device or component affects reproductive function, embryo development (teratogenicity), and prenatal and early postnatal development. (ISO 10993 part 3)
For use when the evaluation is still in progress.
A device that has been used more than once without being cleaned according to the device's cleaning instructions.
The device software attempted to access an illegal or corrupted memory location.
A device that has exceeded the period of time recommended by the manufacturer for storing the device without a degradation in quality.
Device problems traced back to how the device was shipped (some examples may include the temperature of the shipping compartment or the method of transportation).

A device experiencing problems due to an unintentionally low-resistance connection between two points in an electric circuit, resulting in either excessive current flow that often causes damage or in a new shorter circuit that draws current away from the original pathways and components.
Problems with a device due the loss or weakening of a signal or signals.
The device software was not installed as per the specifications or failed to properly install.
The software requirements for the device are either incomplete, inadequate, or in conflict.
The device software failed during operation as a result of a coding error.
The device software failed to provide adequate authorization, access control, and accountability features.
A device problem that results from the incorrect sequencing or activation of software modules.
A device problem that occurred when its material is either too flexible/pliable or inflexible/rigid when in contact by an applied force.
Device problems that result from storing the device in an uncontrolled or improper environment (e.g., moisture sensitive devices stored in a humid environment).
Device problems caused by either excessive or inadequate physical force exerted on it by another object resulting in problems e.g. wear, bending, deformation, fracture, fatigue.
Device problems related to the temperature of the component, device or use environment.

The device or component caused the formation of a stationary blood clot along the walls of a blood vessel resulting in an obstruction. The obstruction can occur by several means e.g. blood clotting problems (coagulation), clots from other areas of the body (emboli), or caused by device materials or reactions to drugs or the removal of drugs.
Device problems that result from a combination of specification variances of the components.
The device software assigned one type of value into a variable of another type.
The device software did not correctly address abnormal execution of the code.
The device software contained code that could never be executed under any circumstance.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Unused Device Returned In Sterile Packaging
CodeItem.fda_definition: An unused device that has been returned in packaging that remains intact.
Device problems caused by the constant rhythmic motion of the device, a device's component, or something in the environment to which the device is exposed.
Device problems due to the premature or expected erosion of its material by use, deterioration, or change.
Communications problems between devices within a wired system.
Communications problems between devices within a wireless system.

SubsetItem.subset_name: Medical Device Problem Codes FDA CDRH

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the premature ending of the charging process (e.g. of a battery or other charge storage device).
Issue associated with any undesired acoustic energy or vibration that tends to interfere with the operation of the device.
Issue associated with compromised device-performance at the ambient room temperature.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Application Interface Becomes Non-Functional Or Program Exits Abnormally

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the deviations from documented system specifications that affects overall system performance and/or the performance of an individual device or collection of devices connected to that system.
Issue associated with the requirement for software to fulfill its function within an intended use or application.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Application Program Version Or Upgrade Problem

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the acquisition of computer programming codes that can replicate and spread from one computer system to another thereby leading to damaged software, hardware and data.
Issue associated with electrical current flowing through a gap between two conductive surfaces, typically resulting in a visible flash of light.
Issue associated with impurities or interference in a signal or image (e.g. ECG artifact).

CodeItem.fda_pt: Blockage Within Device Or Device Component

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with linking of device and/or device components whereby their functional units set up to provide means for a transfer of fluid, gas, or data is prevented or impeded.
Issue associated with undesired damage or breakage of those materials used in device construction.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A fracture of a medical device or one of its components.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with an undesired bulge, bend, bow, kink, or wavy condition observed in the device material resulting from compressive stresses.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Burn Of Device Or Device Component
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issues associated with a discoloration or destruction as a result of thermal decomposition of the device or its components.
Issue associated with the pressure inside a vessel or container rising to such a degree that the container ruptures.
Issue associated with build-up of calcium salts on the device or its components.
Issue associated with the operation of the device, related to its accuracy, and associated with the calibration of the device.
Issue associated with the inability of device and/or device components to achieve successful depolarization and contraction of a cardiac chamber caused by a pacemaker output pulse.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Changes In Ambient Temperature In Device Environment

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the inability of device and/or device components to successfully charge an electrical source.

CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Burn Of Device Or Device Component

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with any deviations from device documented performance specifications relating to any chemical characterization, i.e., element, compound, or mixture.
Issue associated with unintentional pouring out or releasing of chemical substances.
Issue associated with a failure of the internal network paths or electrical circuitry (i.e. electrical components, circuit boards, wiring).

CodeItem.fda_pt: Clumping In Device Or Device Ingredient
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the aggregation of particles into irregular masses.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Sediment, Precipitate Or Deposit In Device Or Device Ingredient

CodeItem.fda_pt: Coagulation In Device Or Device Ingredient
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the undesired characterization of congealing, solidifying, thickening, curdling.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Sediment, Precipitate Or Deposit In Device Or Device Ingredient

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the buckling or crushing of material from external forces.

Issue associated with the device sending or receiving signals or data. This includes transmission among internal components of the device and other external devices to which the device is intended to communicate.
Issue associated with an undesirable descent of a device component due to the force of gravity, usually from a higher to a lower level, usually the ground or floor.
Issue associated with the absence of any part, substance, software, hardware, or raw material that is designed to be put together as part of the finished device or product.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the incompatibility of any device and/or device components while being operated in the same use environment thereby leading to a dysfunction between the device and its components.

Issue associated with the machinery operating system, a collection of software, firmware, and hardware elements that control the execution of computer programs and provides such services as computer resource allocation, job control, input/output control, and file management in a computer system.
Issue associated with written programs, codes, and/or software system that affects device performance or communication with another device.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Issue associated with written programs, codes, and/or software system that affects device performance or communication with another device.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with linking of device and/or device components and/or the functional units set up to provide means for a transfer of liquid, gas, electricity or data.
Issue associated with the undesired introduction of impurities either chemical or microbiological in nature, or of foreign matter into or onto the device at the user facility.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Disinfection Or Sterilization Issue At User Location

CodeItem.fda_pt: Contamination Of Device Ingredient Or Reagent

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the excessive production of electrical impulses over a period.
Issue associated with the chemical or electrochemical reaction between materials, usually a metal and its environment that produces a deterioration of the metal and its properties.
Issue associated with an undesired separation and/or a visible opening along the length or width in the materials that are used in device construction.
Issue associated with the degree to which an antibody or antigen participates in cross reactions.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Sediment, Precipitate Or Deposit In Device Or Device Ingredient

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with problems relating to a system, component, file, procedure, or person available to replace or help restore a primary item in the event of a failure or externally caused disaster.
Event in which data (charting, orders, results) is not correctly stored, transferred, updated, or displayed.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Incorrect transfer, storage, display or updating of data.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with programming of calendar dates and/or time as a factor in the operation of a medical device.
Issue associated with the device and/or device components being un-associated in such a way that fluid, gas, power or signal information may not be transferred from one to another.
Issue associated with the removal by suction of excess fluid or gas from a body cavity.
Issue with the device being less sensitive to an input than intended or expected.
Issue associated with a device component having flaws of dimensional deviations greater than acceptable for the intended use.
Issue associated with having flaws or dimensional deviations greater than acceptable for the intended use of the device.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A medical device that has a defect in structure or function.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the inability of device and/or device components to release its contents.
Issue associated with a deleterious change in the chemical structure, physical properties, or appearance in the materials that are used in device construction.
Issue associated with peeling of composite materials. Occurs when layers are separated as a result of continuous stress or impact. Results in loss of mechanical toughness.
Issue associated with an unexpected amount of time required to charge the device as required (for example, a delay in starting charging or a longer than expected charge time).
Issue associated with the device being received in such a manner to indicate that its sterility has been compromised (e.g. sterile packaging breached, visible contaminate present).
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Item Contaminated During Manufacturing Or Shipping

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with any deviations from device documented performance specifications relating to the sequence of events for activation and positioning of the device or one of its components into a specific body location.
Issue associated with the unintentional separation of the device and/or its components from something to which it is connected or attached.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Detachment Of Device Or Device Component

CodeItem.fda_pt: Detachment Of Device Or Device Component
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the separation of the device and/or device components from its physical construct, integrity, or chassis.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Device Abrasion From Instrument Or Another Object

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with electrical equipment or a system that detects alarm conditions (a state of the alarm system when it has determined that a potential or actual hazard exists) and, as appropriate, generates alarm signals.

Issue associated with the insufficient removal of unwanted visible soil, foreign material or organism deposits on the external surfaces, crevices, joints of a device by a mechanical and/or manual process intended to render the device sterile, safe for handling, and/or for further processes to decontaminate.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Disinfection Or Sterilization Issue At User Location

CodeItem.nci_definition: An issue in which a medical device has an obstructed lumen.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Device Contamination With Blood Or Blood Product

CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_pt: Device Difficult To Setup Or Prepare
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the use of the device in terms of user experiencing difficulty in preparing the device for use, even if the operation is being performed according to labeled instructions for use.
Issue associated with a device prompting user with an error message in order to indicate a device problem.
Issue associated with the expiration date or shelf life of a product.
User handling not in accordance with specification.
Issue associated with the device being in a nonfunctional or inoperable state and cannot be used unless the causes of the inoperability are located and fixed.

CodeItem.nci_definition: An adverse event and reportable event where a medical device may have caused or contributed to a death or serious injury.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the servicing of a device.

Issue associated with the written, printed or graphic material that is affixed to a medical device or any of its containers or wrappers or accompanying the device including verbal instructions, relating to identification, technical description, and usage which are provided by the device manufacturers. Issue can include but is not limited to this material being unclear, missing worn out, incorrect or inaccurate.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_pt: Device Misassembled During Manufacturing Or Shipping
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with any deviations from expected performance while operating and using the device.

Issue associated with any deviations from specifications relating to device operations (e.g. deployment, connection, electrical, computer software, infusion/flow, output, protective-measure, and incompatibility issues).

CodeItem.fda_pt: Device Or Device Component Damaged By Another Device
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with one device and/or device component causing harm to another device and/or component.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Device Or Device Fragments Location Unknown

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the non-conformance to device specifications and minimum packaging requirements as the device may not be operating and functioning as intended.
Issue associated with the device continuing to be in an active state after deactivation was requested.

Issue associated with device features that are designed to respond to a physical stimulus (temperature, illumination, motion, cardiac rhythms) that do not transmit a resulting signal for interpretation or measurement.
Issue associated with any deviation from device document specification relating to the irregular rate at which the device stops.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Device Unsafe To Use In Environment

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the incompatibility of two or more devices while being operated in the same use environment thereby leading to a dysfunction of more than one device.
CodeItem.nci_definition: The inability of two or more devices to work together.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with difficulty moving the device or its components to an intended location (e.g. difficulty in advancing guidewire).
Issue associated with users experiencing difficulty or uneasiness to deploy device and/or device components to a specified location.

Issue associated with the use of the device in terms of user experiencing difficulty to close or to spread out/extend length of a device, even if the operation is being performed according to labeled instructions for use.
Issue associated with problems introducing or inserting the device, even if the user is operating the device in accordance with the instructions for use or labeling.
Issue associated with difficulty of a transponder system to trigger a response.

Issue associated with the use of the device in terms of user experiencing difficulty opening and closing the device, even if the operation is being performed according to labeled instructions for use.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Difficult To Open Or Remove Packaging Material
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with difficulty for end-users to operate device, specifically as it relates to the opening or removal of the outer wrapping.

Issue associated with the use of the device in terms of user experiencing difficulty to put device and/or device components in place, even if the operation is being performed according to labeled instructions for use.
Issue associated with the user's ability to cause device settings or actions to change to the state desired by the user.

Issue associated with the use of the device in terms of user experiencing difficulty to take out or get rid of a device and/or device components, even if the operation is being performed according to labeled instructions for use.

CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Detachment Of Device Or Device Component

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the linking of device and/or device components having a sufficient open space to prevent gas, liquid or electrical current flow between connectors.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Disinfection Or Sterilization Issue At User Location
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the undesired introduction of impurities to a device, or the insufficient removal of any visible soil, foreign material or organism deposits on the external surfaces, crevices, and joints of a device by a mechanical and/or manual process intended to render the device sterile, safe for handling, and/or for further processes to decontaminate. This issue is restricted to happening at the location where the device is used as opposed to during manufacturer or shipping.
Issue associated with mechanical force that displaces device and/or device components from an intended location.
CodeItem.nci_definition: An issue associated with a medical device or a piece of the medical device that has moved from the intended location.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with not correctly reading the patient or test result information provided by the device.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Dose Calculation Error Due To Software Problem

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with a failure of the electrical circuitry or components of the device.
Issue associated with an electrical activity that exceeded the specified threshold limit of the internal integrated circuitry.
Issue associated with the quality of the facility-supplied power.
Issue associated with the ability of a system to function in its electromagnetic environment without introducing intolerable disturbances to anything in its environment.
Issue associated with a measure of electromagnetic radiation from equipment.

Issue associated with any deviations from device documented performance specifications relating to devices, circuits, or systems utilizing electrons and in association with components to convert, control and condition of electric power (alternating or direct current), and of voltage and current.
Issue associated with the discharge of electricity between two bodies previously electrically charged.
Issue associated with the failure of the facility's emergency power backup systems(s) including generators and/or uninterruptible power systems (UPS).

CodeItem.fda_pt: Energy Output To Patient Tissue Incorrect
Entrapment Of Device Or Device Component
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the device and/or device accessories caught within patient vasculature, tissue, or other devices or device components.
Issue associated with the surrounding conditions in which the device is being used such as temperature, noise, lighting, ventilation, or other external factors such as power supply.
Issue associated with fine solids or liquid particles such as dust, smoke, fume, and/or mist suspended in the immediate atmosphere in which the device is being used.
Issue associated with the device or its components producing temperatures that are lower than specified.
Issue associated with errors in identification of expiration date.
Issue associated with the unintended ejection of device component materials.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Migration Of Device Or Device Component

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the unintended of projection of device component materials.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Migration Of Device Or Device Component

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the physical establishment and environment in which medical devices are transported, stored, processed, serviced or used within the user facility.
Issue associated with safety features malfunctioning in such a way that results in harm to the patient or device operator.
Issue associated with the device failing to perform an internal self-diagnostic process to ensure normal operation during or prior to use.
Issue associated with difficulties in attaching a device to another object including another device or device component or to a patient body part.
Issue associated with failure to move the device or its components to an intended location.
Issue associated with a circuit, equipment, or system whereby its functions fail to be properly synchronized or its relative positions properly oriented.
Issue associated with the inability of a device to turn itself off when the device is not in an operable condition.
Issue associated with the inability to backup or to retrieve a backed up version (corrupted file) of device data or system files.
Issue associated with the failure of the device to perform a self-calibration procedure or process designed to assure the accuracy and proper performance of the device.
Issue associated with the failure to achieve effective and consistent depolarization of the heart resulting from the electrical stimulus of the pacemaker.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Failure of a medical device to cause myocardial depolarization.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with inability to initiate the appropriate charging process (e.g. of a battery or other charge storage device).
Issue associated with the inability of a device and/or device components to allow a current of electricity to pass or to conduct electricity continuously along an electrical path.
Failure of a device therapy or set of therapies to terminate the arrhythmia that the therapy is meant to terminate.
Issue associated with the device failing to complete a series of processes or events.
Issues associated with the effective electromotive force within a system that fails to oppose the passage of current in a specified direction.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Shock Or Properly Shock

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the inability of device and/or device components to be activated and positioned in a specified location.
Issue associated with the failure of a battery or other charge storage device to appropriately discharge as intended.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Shock Or Properly Shock

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the linking of device and/or device components whereby termination of the transfer of liquid, gas, electricity, or information cannot be accomplished, or linking components do not come apart, or disconnect, when expected.
Issue associated with the device or one of its components failing to expand.
Issue associated with a therapy or algorithm not being delivered or executed at the expected time.
Issue associated with the device failure to appropriately respond to signals from a system designed to interrogate its status.
Issue associated with the failure to see direct anchorage of an implant by the formation of bony tissue around the implant without the growth of fibrous tissue at the bone-implant interface.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Failure To Pace Or Properly Pace
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the inability of device and/or device components to generate a therapeutic simulated heart beat via electrical impulses once arrhythmia is detected.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Failure To Run On Portable Mode
CodeItem.fda_synonym: Portable Mode, Failure To Run On

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the failure of a device designed to respond to a physical stimulus (as temperature, illumination, motion) to transmit a resulting signal for interpretation or measurement.
Issue associated with the device or one of its components failing to detach or separate as intended.
Issue associated with the lack of periodic preventive maintenance or performance assurance checks.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Failure To Shock Or Properly Shock
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the inability of device and/or device components to provide an appropriate or successful electrical shock.
Issue associated with the device not powering off when a shut down was requested.
Failure of device to generate a correctly-shaped pacing output, for example, a waveform that is too wide.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Pace Or Properly Pace

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the comprising materials' deformation in that a device fails to open its wrapping or open/extend to a certain fashion or form i.e. balloon or lens.
Issue associated with problems removing the materials used to construct the cover or outer wrapping of the device.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Difficult To Open Or Remove Packaging Material

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with device providing incorrect alarm warning or alert to user.
Issue associated with the device incorrectly reporting that something has not been detected and misleads the operator into not taking certain actions when action should be taken.
Issue associated with the device incorrectly reporting that something has been detected and misleads the operator to take certain actions.
Issue associated with the non-compliance of the device to meet its specific performance characteristics thereby causing a false reading.
Issue associated with the method or amount of time associated with the delivery of a fluid. Time to delivery or amount of delivered entity may be affected.
Issue associated with the process of passing a substance through a porous medium, e.g., a blood clot filter for the removal of suspended matter.
Issues associated with the combustion of device components, resulting in any of the following: light, flame, smoke.

Issue associated with the connection of device and/or device components whereby channels, switching systems, and other functional units set up to provide means for a transfer of liquid, gas, electricity, or information do not match or fit.
Issue associated with the detachment of small pieces of the coating film of a material.
Issue associated with device-related burn with an unsteady flame.
Issue associated with approaching certain temperatures at which a combustible liquid ignites.
Issue associated with the visibility of water vapor in the immediate atmosphere in which the device is being used.
Issue associated with the presence of materials, which are not part of the documented device specifications and requirements.
Issue associated with any structural discontinuity in the material; collective term for cracks, splitting etc.
Issue associated with uncontrolled flow of infusion of air, gas or fluids.
Issue associated with the visibility, odor, or toxicity of an ambient vapor or gas which affects the operation of the device.
Issue associated with the visibility of molds, mildews, yeasts, and/or mushrooms in the immediate environment in which a device is being used.
Issue associated with the unintended escape of a gas from the container in which it is housed.
Issue associated with the increased rate of change in temperature, pressure, or other variables as a function of distance, time, etc.
Issue associated with the inability to connect conductors of an electronic system for the purpose of controlling or impeding ground currents and voltages.
Issue associated with the amount of output energy needed to cause cardiac depolarization being higher than expected/desired.
Issue associated with higher than intended electrical impedance levels between device components or device and patient connections.
Issue associated with the amount of input required by the device to detect a signal being higher than expected/desired.
Issue associated with an opening not characteristic of the normal material.
Issue associated with the interaction and interfacing between devices and users in terms of users' abilities, expectations, and limitations with work environments and system design.
Event in which measurement functions produce erroneous results or the image display is corrupted.
Issue associated with an incorrect image orientation on the device display.
Issue associated with electrical impedance levels between device components or device and patient connections.
Issue associated with an unexpected or inappropriate chemical reaction or effect.
Issue associated with the inaccurate outcome of a measurement/values/data obtained from the device being different from displayed, printed, stored, or exported measurements/values/data.
Issue associated with the unsubstantiated regulation and delivery of therapy, e.g., air, gas, drugs or fluids into a device or a patient under positive pressure that is being generated by a pump.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Improper Or Incorrect Procedure Or Method
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the use of the device in terms of non-conforming to that device's intended use, specifications, procedure and process or service instructions and information provided by the device manufacturers.
Issue associated with an error due to imperfect timing of two operations; this may or may not include signal transmission time.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Pace Or Properly Pace

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with inaccuracies in any written, printed, or graphic matter that is affixed to a medical device or its containers, wrappers; with any matter that accompanies a medical device including verbal instructions related to identification, technical description and use of the medical device provided by the device manufacturers.

Issue associated with users being unclear and not able to follow any written, printed, or graphic matter that is affixed to a medical device or its containers, wrappers; with any matter that accompanies a medical device including verbal instructions related to identification, technical description and use of the medical device provided by the device manufactures that vary from the standard of medical care in a given environment.
Issue associated with an inappropriate level of light or illumination in the immediate environment in which the device is being used or stored.
Issue associated with inadequate periodic preventive maintenance or performance assurance checks.
Issue associated with inadequate or inappropriate storage of the device, not otherwise described.
Issue associate with facility not providing satisfactory initial and/or periodic user training covering operation of the device.
Issue associated with the means by which the operator and the equipment communicate or interact.
Issue associated with the inability to appropriately perform or generate any automated setting if no specific selection has made by the users.
Issue associated with the inappropriate delivery of an electrical energy.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Shock Or Properly Shock

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the device not being compatible with another device component or substance (medication, body fluid etc) that it contains or transports. Does not refer to device issues related to disconnection.
Issue associated with the heart valve leaflet not closing properly.
Issue associated with the delivery of an inappropriate device or device component to a user facility.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with device failure and malfunction when device does not display adequate results or have proper display.
Issue associated with a non-conforming end result, data, or test results provided by the device to its performance specifications.
Issue with the device being more sensitive to an input than intended or expected.
Issue associated with the inability of a device and/or device components to expand or enlarge with the intended inflation agent (e.g. saline or air).
Issue associated with the device failing to deliver liquids or gases as intended (e.g. delivering drugs at incorrect rate, issues with drawing fluid from a system etc).
Issue associated with unsatisfactory installation, configuration, and/or setup of a specific device or technology.

Issue associated with the accuracy and appropriateness of any written, printed, graphic or audio/visual matter that is supplied with a medical device or its containers, wrappers; with any matter that accompanies a medical device including instructions related to identification, technical description and use of the medical device provided by the device manufacturer.

Issue associated with device or device parts being insufficiently cool in device active (working) or/and non-active (non-working) state. The concept does not refer to the problem resulted from ambient temperature.
Issue associated with an underdose of intravenous therapy, i.e., drugs or fluids being delivered into a patient under positive pressure generated by a pump.
Issue associated with the device or its components producing temperatures that are not as high as what is specified.
Issue associated with the ineffective and inconsistent depolarization of the heart.

Issue associated with the failure to deliver shock for a limited period of time, following which the item recovers its ability to perform its required function without being subjected to any external corrective action. Note: such as failure is often recurrent.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Shock Or Properly Shock

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the inaccuracy of a device designed to respond to an input (such as temperature, illumination, motion) to transmit a resulting signal that can not be used for interpretation or measurement.
Issue associated with error messages that are undecipherable or which fail to prompt the user toward appropriate corrective action.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Item Contaminated During Manufacturing Or Shipping
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the presence of any unexpected foreign substance found on the surface or in the package materials, which may affect optimal performance for its intended use.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_pt: Lack Of Maintenance Documentation Or Guidelines
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with user facility not receiving adequate service documentation, guidelines, or recommendations to perform preventive and corrective maintenance and performance assurance checks.
Issue associated with the escape of a liquid or gas from the vessel or container in which it is housed.
CodeItem.nci_definition: The unintended escape of a substance contained within a medical device.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Event in which information is unintentionally permanently or temporarily lost, deleted, corrupted, or overwritten.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Loss Of Or Failure To Bond
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with lack or loss of adherence between materials intended to be joined together by an adhesive.
Issue associated with the failure of primary power supplied by the facility.
Issue associated with the loss of the minimum amount of energy, voltage, or current needed to consistently stimulate the heart muscle.
Issue associated with lower than intended electrical impedance levels between device components or device and patient connections.
Issue associated with the amount of an input required by the device to detect a signal being lower than expected/desired.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Maintenance Does Not Comply To Manufacturers Recommendations
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the non-compliance or non-performance to manufacturer specifications relating to device routine maintenance, i.e., periodic inspection, failure detection, repair, and care of the device to sustain or restore acceptable operating conditions.
Issue associated with device being positioned in a location other than intended or specified.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with any deviations from device documented performance specifications relating to non-conformity during manufacture to the design of an item or to specified manufacturing processes.
Issue associated with an undesired material change in shape or property caused by external forces.
Issue associated with an undesired streak, pattern, and/or a noticeable change in color from the rest of the materials used in device construction.
Issue associated with material breaking into small fragments or particles.
Issue associated with undesired physical appearance of device material resulting from excessive stress or impact.
Issue associated with a progressive loss of a material from a solid surface.
Issue associated with small pieces of the device breaking off unexpectedly.
Issue associated with the comprising materials having damaged edges.
Issue associated with any deviations from device documented performance specifications relating to the limited durability of all material used to construct the device.
Issue associated with an undesirable opaqueness or cloudiness.
Issue associated with an undesired material damage characterized by closely spaced punched or drilled holes.
Issue associated with undesired physical appearance of device material, specifically when material extends beyond or above the device surface.
Issue associated with the comprising material(s) being penetrated, pierced or punctured, especially with a sharp or pointed object.
Issue associated with the bursting or tearing apart of a material.
Issue associated with an undesired disassociation or breaking apart of device materials.
Issue associated with a movement of forces that produces or tends to produce rotation or torsion of a material

Issue associated with the incompatibility of the measurement systems between and/or within device systems that are inherent to the individual device thereby leading to miscalculated or mismatched measurements from those devices, e.g., international metric system versus U.S. measurement system.
Issues associated with any deviations from device documented performance specifications relating to mechanical defects, including moving parts or subassemblies, etc.
Issue associated with a problem that prevents or restricts the motion of the device or its components.
Issue associated with device mechanical functioning of machinery, moving parts or tools of the device being changed or modified.
Issue associated with the facility-supplied medical gases such as medical air, oxygen, nitrous oxide, and nitrogen.
Event in which the device software design results in errors of medication preparation or administration.
CodeItem.nci_definition: An error in medication preparation or administration attributed to software.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with a solid device or device components being transformed into a molten or liquid state.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Migration Of Device Or Device Component
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with an undesired movement of device and/or device components, related to its movement away from or dislodging from a source.
Issue associated with the use of the device characterized by users' incorrect assembly of device components, parts or constituents.
Issue associated with the connection of device and/or device components being improper or not in accordance with device specification, requirements and intended uses.
Issue associated with failure of device to discharge its load (e.g. surgical stapler failed to partially or completely deploy its staples).
Issue associated with the results of a test or measurement not appearing.

CodeItem.nci_definition: A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available. A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept. In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with damage inflicted upon the device or device components from water vapor or water in the immediate environment in which the device is being used.
Issue associated with an unsatisfactory humidity level in the storage or use environment which affects device performance.

Issue associated with material damage to a surface, usually involving progressive loss or displacement of material, due to relative motion between that surface and a contacting substance or substances.
Issue associated with no measurement outcome, value, or data obtained from the device.
Issue associated with the absence of visual indicator.
Issue arising from the device failing to deliver the specified liquid or gas.

CodeItem.nci_definition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the device ceasing to deliver paces.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Pace Or Properly Pace

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with any unintended sound which emanates from a device (for example, squeaking from two parts rubbing together or buzzing sounds from electrical components).
CodeItem.nci_definition: An unintended or unpleasant sound that emanates from a device.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with a material that does not meet the specifications or requirements for which it was manufactured, and has not been subjected to use or processing other than that required for its initial manufacture.
If a value for test has to be provided, but has no given criteria (e.g., the result is for "report only" or "monitoring").
CodeItem.nci_definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
Thee circumstance in which a device used for medical purposes fails to perform as intended due to a blocked passage within the device.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with an obstruction or blockage within any of the device components (e.g. tube, opening, pipe) that results in a restriction of flow.
Issue associated with malfunction of the computer operating system as opposed to an application software issue.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Operating System Version Or Upgrade Problem
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with replacing an older operation system to an up-to-date operation system.
Issue associated with being off-center of optical lenses.
Issue associated with an optical streak or other pattern on the signal surface that causes a noticeable change of color from the rest of the pultruded surface.
Issue associated with an optical defect in an image-forming system whereby the image is not the shape of an ideal image of the object.
Issue associated with problems transmitting visible light affecting the quality of the image transmitted or otherwise affecting the intended application of the visible light path.
Issue associated with the blocking of optical devices, e.g., visual pathways.
Issue associated with interconnection between bone tissue and implanted device.
Issue associated with any deviation from device documented performance specifications relating to the end result, data, or test results provided by the device.
Issue associated with an adjustment that surpasses a set criterion.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Overheating Of Device Or Device Component
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the device producing high temperatures, such that its operation is compromised (e.g. overheating that produces melting of components or automatic shutdown).

CodeItem.nci_definition: A difficulty with a medical device detecting unintended signals.

CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Pace Or Properly Pace

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with a pacing transmission process such that between any two significant instants in the same group, there is always an integral number of unit intervals. Between two significant instants located in different groups, there are not always an integral number of unit intervals.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Pace Or Properly Pace

CodeItem.fda_definition: Pacing voltage or pulse width is less than desired.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Pace Or Properly Pace

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the failure of pacing device for a limited period of time, following which the item recovers its ability to perform its required function without being subjected to any external corrective action. Note: such as failure is often recurrent.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Failure To Pace Or Properly Pace

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the materials used to construct the cover or outer wrapping of the device.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_pt: Parameter Calculation Error Due To Software Problem

CodeItem.fda_definition: Substances that consist of separate particles that are introduced by the device during use.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Sediment, Precipitate Or Deposit In Device Or Device Ingredient

CodeItem.fda_definition: Event in which information is accessed by the healthcare provider and either the wrong patient of the wrong information is retrieved despite correct inquiry procedures.
CodeItem.nci_definition: The retrieval of incorrect data about a particular patient.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the interaction between the patient's physiology or anatomy and the device that affects patient and/or device (e.g. biocompatibility issues, patient's weight exceeds safe working load of a lifting device).
Issue associated with stresses of sufficient magnitude to exceed the strength of adhesion between the device material and its coating, i.e., insulation pulling away from a wire, label peeling off.
Issue associated with the escape of blood around a heart valve, particularly around its leaflets.

Issue associated with any deviations from specifications relating to device physical properties in terms of material integrity, mechanical, manufacturing/shipping, communication/transmission, optical, temperature, chemical, and electronic issues.
Issue associated with the corrosion of a material's surface, confined to a point or small area that takes the form of cavities.
Issue associated with a pocket of skin in which the pulse generator is housed.
Issue associated with an image or any visual representation displayed by the device with non- distinctive characteristics.
Issue associated with the movement of the device and/or device components to an intended location.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Power Calculation Error Due To Software Problem

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with inadequate power conditioning such as the presence of fluctuation, surges, spikes, dropouts, noise and other such undesirable transients.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Precipitate In Device Or Device Ingredient
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the separation of solid particles from a liquid as the result of a chemical or physical change.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Sediment, Precipitate Or Deposit In Device Or Device Ingredient

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with an early and unexpected deployment of the device and/or device components from the system.
Issue associated with the application of a force either internal or external to the device that compromises the flow of fluid or gas.
Issue associated with installing the device software in a manner that allows full functioning of the device. Source of installation could be manufacturer or user.

CodeItem.fda_synonym: Device Or Device Component Quality Issue
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with an inherent device and/or device component characteristic that is not satisfactory as specified or delivered.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A difficulty with the quality of part of the device or the device itself.
CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Manufacturing Or Shipping Issue Associated With Device

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the written program code or application software used to satisfy a stated need or objective for functioning of the device. These do not include issues associated with the operating system.

Issue associated with any deviations from device documented performance specifications relating to the implemented and inherited design features specific to devices used for reducing risks to patient or caregiver or maintaining risks within specified levels.
Issue associated with pump performance deviating from specifications in a way to compromise flow or infusion.
Issue associated with excessive radiation emitted from radiological or diagnostic device.
Issue associated with too little radiation emitted from radiological or diagnostic devices. Results in insufficient production of normal image contrast.
Issue associated with the wireless transmission signal in the lowest range of the electromagnetic spectrum.
Issue associated with the degradation of the reception of a wanted signal caused by RF disturbance.
Issue associated with a backward or return flow.
Issue associated with setting a variable, register, or other storage location back to a prescribed state.
Issue associated with the decontamination process not adequately removing unwanted visible soil, foreign material, or organism deposits.
Issue associated with drawing back the device and/or device component to an intended location.
Issue associated with an undesirable shallow cut or narrow groove in the surface of the device materials.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Sediment, Precipitate Or Deposit In Device Or Device Ingredient

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the unintended activation of device, or device having been unexpectedly turned on during use.
Issue associated with the using a device after the marked or known shelf life.
Issue associated with device inability to act as a barrier for absorption of radiation energy in X-rays, gamma rays, etc.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Slippage Of Device Or Device Component

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with a cloud of vapor or gas generated from the device, generally associated after a fire or a burn.

CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Loss Of Or Failure To Bond

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with a flash of light related to an electrical discharge in an unexpected location.
Issue associated with a partial or full-thickness crack in the device materials.
Issue associated with an increase or elongation in a materials' dimension.
Issue associated with the basic physical construction or physical make up of the device.

Issue associated with suction equipment, which may be a manual, electrical, vacuum or pressure source operated to evacuate and remove undesired substances (air, gas, fluid, or particulates via tubing and collection bag).

CodeItem.fda_pt: Tear, Rip Or Hole In Device Packaging

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with variability of the transmission of signals, which can be characterized as telemetry channel coding, a method of processing data sent from a source to a destination so that distinct messages are created which are easily distinguishable from one another.
Issue associated with the device producing unintended temperatures (for issues related to environmental/ambient temperatures refer to code C63307).
Issue associated with the failure of the device to deliver any end results relating to treatment or identification of a disease.

CodeItem.fda_pt: Therapy Delivered To Incorrect Body Area
CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the device causing unintended therapeutic action to an area of the body other than the intended area.
Issue associated with the amount of gas that is inspired and expired during one respiratory cycle.
Issue associated with comprising material(s) being pulled apart or into pieces by force, wrenching, or laceration.

Issue associated with the transfer of fluid between the blood and dialysate through the dialysis membrane due to a pressure gradient (transmembrane pressure) existing between the blood and dialysate compartments.

Issue associated with an access that was not permitted to the computer system that may lead to modification of program, corruption of data, or and break in network security. This concept is closely associated with computer integrity which is the degree to which a system or component prevents unauthorized access to, or modification of, computer programs or data.

CodeItem.nci_definition: A difficulty with a medical device not detecting a signal at the intended threshold.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with the use of a medical device for therapeutic purposes.
Issue associated with device or device components impacting with another object.
Issue associated with unexpected discharge of device from expected location - includes but not limited to devices such as clip appliers, film cartridge, staples.

CodeItem.parent_fdapt: Overheating Of Device Or Device Component

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with an undesired movement of device, which may be related to device malfunction, misdiagnosis, or mistreatment.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Movement of a medical device to an unintended location within the body.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with any motion of the system or components that was not initiated by the user.
Issue associated with the connection of device and/or device components not possessing stability, or is unbounded.
Issue with the amount of output energy needed to cause cardiac depolarization being unstable.
Issue associated with user's failure to process, service, or operate the device according to the manufacturer's recommendations or recognized best practices.
Issue associated with the use of the device in terms of inappropriate and false control setting for the device's specified operation and/or intended use.

CodeItem.fda_pt: User Used Incorrect Product For Intended Use

CodeItem.fda_definition: Issue associated with an oscillation wherein the quantity is a parameter that defines the motion of a mechanical system.

Issue related to the transmission and reception of wireless medical device signals and data and the effects on the safety, effectiveness and functions of the medical device. These include issues related to wireless transmission and reception such as data integrity, timeliness, and reliability of transmitted signals and data. It can include issues with the RF wireless technology characteristics and performance (e.g., frequency, output power, range, reception), wireless quality of service, wireless coexistence, security of wireless signals and data, and electromagnetic compatibility.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Any issue that impedes communication with a medical device that can be attributed to the wireless function.
An involuntary muscular contraction involving a muscle of the abdomen or of a hollow organ within the abdomen.
The unintentional or intentional loss of a pregnancy before 22 weeks gestation.

CodeItem.fda_definition: All products of conception are expelled and identified.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Expulsion of all the products of conception following spontaneous, medical or operative pregnancy termination.

CodeItem.fda_definition: The uterus is not entirely emptied of its contents.
CodeItem.nci_definition: The uterus is not entirely emptied of products of conception following spontaneous, medical or operative pregnancy termination.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Abortion brought on intentionally.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Abortion brought on intentionally.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Retention in uterus of an abortus that has been dead at least 4 weeks.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Retention in uterus of an abortus.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Abraded wound; excoriation or circumscribed removal of the superficial layers of the skin or mucous membrane.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Superficial damage to the skin caused by rubbing or scraping.

An inflammatory process characterized by the accumulation of pus within a newly formed tissue cavity which is the result of a bacterial, fungal, or parasitic infection or the presence of a foreign body.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Failure of the smooth muscle fibers of the gastrointestinal tract to relax at any one point of junction of one part with another.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Failure of the smooth muscle fibers of the gastrointestinal tract to relax at any one point of junction of one part with another.
Injury to the hearing mechanisms within the inner ear, caused by excessively loud noise.
A fibrous band of tissue that connects normally separate body regions.

Progressive and life-threatening pulmonary distress in the absence of an underlying pulmonary condition, usually following major trauma or surgery. Cases of neonatal respiratory distress syndrome are not included in this definition.

A syndrome resulting from the acquired deficiency of cellular immunity caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). It is characterized by the reduction of the Helper T-lymphocytes in the peripheral blood and the lymph nodes. Symptoms include generalized lymphadenopathy, fever, weight loss, and chronic diarrhea. Patients with AIDS are especially susceptible to opportunistic infections (usually pneumocystis carinii pneumonia, cytomegalovirus (CMV) infections, tuberculosis, candida infections, and cryptococcosis), and the development of malignant neoplasms (usually non-Hodgkin lymphoma and Kaposi sarcoma). The human immunodeficiency virus is transmitted through sexual contact, sharing of contaminated needles, or transfusion of contaminated blood.

CodeItem.fda_definition: The presence of bubbles of gas in the vascular system; occurrence is related to the entry of air into the venous circulation following trauma or surgery.
CodeItem.nci_definition: The presence of bubbles of air in the vascular system; occurrence is related to the entry of air into the venous circulation following trauma or surgery.
Blockage of air flow in the respiratory tract.
Any persistent problem with walking.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Inflammation of the amnion.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Inflammation of the amnion.
Resembling anaphylaxis.

A peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma, consisting of usually large anaplastic, CD30 positive cells. The majority of cases are positive for the anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALK) protein. The most frequently seen genetic alteration is a t(2;5) translocation. Majority of patients present with advanced disease. The most important prognostic indicator is ALK positivity, which has been associated with a favorable prognosis. (WHO, 2001)
Failure of a surgically-induced connection between tubular structures in the body.

A reduction in the number of red blood cells, the amount of hemoglobin, and/or the volume of packed red blood cells. Clinically, anemia represents a reduction in the oxygen-transporting capacity of a designated volume of blood, resulting from an imbalance between blood loss (through hemorrhage or hemolysis) and blood production. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability.
A state of consciousness that permits the formation of explicit and implicit memories while under general anesthesia.
Bulging or ballooning in an area of an artery secondary to arterial wall weakening.
Paroxysms of chest pain due to reduced oxygen to the heart.
Absence or reduction of oxygen in body tissue.
Apprehension of danger and dread accompanied by restlessness, tension, tachycardia, and dyspnea unattached to a clearly identifiable stimulus.
A progressive tear in the tissue lining the aorta, characterized by the passage of blood from the tunica intima into, and partially through, the tunica media.
Dysfunction of the aortic valve characterized by incomplete valve closure.

CodeItem.fda_definition: The backward flow of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle, owing to insufficiency of the aortic semilunar valve; it may be chronic or acute.
CodeItem.nci_definition: The backward flow of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle, owing to insufficiency of the aortic semilunar valve; it may be chronic or acute.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Narrowing of the orifice of the aortic valve or of the supravalvular or subvalvular regions.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Narrowing of the orifice of the aortic valve.
An Apgar score less than seven.
A procedure that collects a component of the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.
Excision of the apex of the petrous portion of the temporal bone.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Cessation of breathing.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Transient cessation of respiration.

CodeItem.fda_definition: A chronic adhesive arachnoiditis in the spinal arachnoid, with root and spinal cord symptoms similar to those caused by pressure from a tumor.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A chronic adhesive arachnoiditis in the spinal arachnoid, with root and spinal cord symptoms similar to those caused by pressure from a tumor.
Any variation from the normal rate or rhythm (which may include the origin of the impulse and/or its subsequent propagation) in the heart.
A vascular disorder characterized by thickening and hardening of the walls of the arteries.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Pain in a joint.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Pain in a joint.

An inflammatory process affecting a joint. Causes include infection, autoimmune processes, degenerative processes, and trauma. Signs and symptoms may include swelling around the affected joint and pain.

A chronic, systemic autoimmune disorder characterized by inflammation in the synovial membranes and articular surfaces. It manifests primarily as a symmetric, erosive polyarthritis that spares the axial skeleton and is typically associated with the presence in the serum of rheumatoid factor.
The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

CodeItem.fda_definition: A condition due to lack of oxygen in respired air, resulting in impending or actual cessation of life.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A state of general hypoxia and hypercapnea, resulting in acidosis, which affects all tissues in the body.

The entry of foreign material past the trachea, and into the lower respiratory tract. Oro-pharyngeal or gastric secretions are the most commonly aspirated materials, and can cause a pneumonitis or pneumonia.
A chronic respiratory disease manifested as difficulty breathing due to the narrowing of bronchial passageways.
Build-up of fatty material and calcium deposition in the arterial wall resulting in partial or complete occlusion of the arterial lumen.

CodeItem.fda_definition: An arrhythmia in which minute areas of the atrial myocardium are in various uncoordinated stages of depolarization and repolarization; instead of intermittently contracting, the atria quiver continuously in a chaotic pattern, causing a totally irregular, often rapid ventricular rate.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of a supraventricular arrhythmia characterized by the replacement of consistent P waves by rapid oscillations or fibrillatory waves that vary in size, shape and timing and are accompanied by an irregular ventricular response. (CDISC)

A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of an organized, regular atrial rhythm with atrial rate of 240-340 beats per minute. Multiple P waves typically appear in the inferior leads in a saw tooth-like pattern between the QRS complexes. (CDISC)
A rupture in atrial tissue due to traumatic or pathologic processes.

A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of an organized, regular atrial rhythm with atrial rate between 101 and 240 beats per minute. The P wave morphology must be distinct from the sinus P wave morphology. (CDISC)

A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

A specific humoral or cell-mediated immune response against autologous (self) antigens. An autoimmune process may produce or be caused by autoimmune disease and may be developmentally complex, not necessarily pathological, and possibly pervasive.
Cirrhosis of the liver caused either by destruction of the intrahepatic bile ducts (primary biliary cirrhosis) or blockage of the extrahepatic bile ducts (secondary biliary cirrhosis).
Loss of blood from the circulation, either internally or externally.
Blurred vision is the loss of visual acuity (sharpness of vision) resulting in a loss of ability to see small details. (from MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia)
A rupture in the wall of the small or large intestine due to traumatic or pathologic processes.
An abnormally slow heart rate. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist.
Trauma to the brain.

A mass in the mammary gland, either mobile or immobile. Once the mass has reached the size of a small garden pea, it can be detected by palpation. With mammography a larger number of early breast cancers are being detected since this techniques allows detection prior to the point at which the mass can be felt. Breast masses are not always malignant. Benign fibrocystic breast disease is not uncommon. A fine needle biopsy aspiration can distinguish a cystic mass from a solid one.
A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma. It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue. Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males.
An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting the bronchi.

Acute inflammation of the walls of the terminal bronchioles that spreads into the peribronchial alveoli and alveolar ducts. It results in the creation of foci of consolidation, which are surrounded by normal parenchyma. It affects one or more lobes, and is frequently bilateral and basal. It is usually caused by bacteria (e.g., Staphylococcus, Streptococcus, Haemophilus influenzae). Signs and symptoms include fever, cough with production of brown-red sputum, dyspnea, and chest pain.
Sudden contraction of the smooth muscles of the bronchial wall.
Injury of the soft tissues or bone without breaking the skin that is characterized by blood leakage into the surrounding area.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Injury to tissues caused by contact with dry heat, moist heat, flames, chemicals, electricity, friction or radiant and electromagnetic energy. A first degree burn is associated with redness, a second degree burn with vesication and a third degree burn with necrosis through the entire skin.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A traumatic injury involving interruption of tissue cohesiveness that results from exposure to caustic chemicals, extreme heat, extreme cold or excessive radiation.
Chemical or radiant injury to the cornea.
A burn injury caused by heat or fire.
A sensation of stinging or heat, not necessarily accompanied by redness or physical signs of irritation.
Deposition of calcium in the tissues. It may be the result of a metabolic disorder or long-standing infection, or it may be associated with the presence of cancer.

A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.

CodeItem.fda_definition: The tightening of scar tissue that forms around the implant.
CodeItem.nci_definition: The tightening of scar tissue that forms around the implant.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Sudden cessation of the pumping function of the heart, with disappearance of arterial blood pressure, connoting either ventricular fibrillation or ventricular standstill.
CodeItem.nci_definition: The sudden cessation of cardiac activity in an individual who becomes unresponsive, without normal breathing and no signs of circulation. Cardiac arrest may be reversed by CPR, and/or defibrillation, cardioversion or cardiac pacing.
The presence of an acquired hole in the heart. Cardiac perforation may or may not be symptomatic and may or may not be self sealing. (ACC)

CodeItem.fda_definition: Acute compression of the heart caused by increased intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardium from rupture of the heart, penetrating trauma, or progressive effusion.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Acute compression of the heart caused by increased intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardium from rupture of the heart, penetrating trauma, or progressive effusion.

A disease of the heart muscle or myocardium proper. Cardiomyopathies may be classified as either primary or secondary, on the basis of etiology, or on the pathophysiology of the lesion: hypertrophic, dilated, or restrictive.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Cessation of breathing and/or cardiac function.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Cessation of breathing and/or cardiac function.

Partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes that decreases visual acuity and eventually results in blindness. Some cataracts appear in infancy or in childhood, but most develop in older individuals. (Sternberg Diagnostic Surgical Pathology, 3rd ed.)

CodeItem.fda_definition: A cataract that has been produced artificially or by induction, e.g. as a result of device use, medication, trauma, tears, falls, accidental injury, etc.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A cataract that has been produced artificially or by induction, e.g. as a result of device use, medication, trauma, tears, falls, accidental injury, etc.
A burn caused by exposure to chemical substances.
Inflammation of the dermis and subcutaneous tissues caused by a bacterial infection. Symptoms include erythema, edema, and pain to the affected area.

CodeItem.fda_definition: A subperiosteal hemorrhage limited to the surface of one cranial bone, a usually benign condition seen in the newborn as a result of bone trauma.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A subperiosteal hemorrhage limited to the surface of one cranial bone, a usually benign condition seen in the newborn as a result of bone trauma.
Abnormal enlargement of the cerebral ventricles.
The loss of cerebrospinal fluid into the surrounding tissues.
A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Changes such as abnormal, pathological, benign, malignant, etc.

CodeItem.nci_definition: Contact with a chemical substance through touch, inhalation, or ingestion.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Excessive edema of the ocular conjunctiva.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Edema of the mucous membrane of the eyeball and eyelid lining.
Pain in the chest.
Shivering or moderate tremors of the body often accompanied by a cold sensation.
Interference with respiration by compression or obstruction of the larynx or trachea.
A morphologic finding indicating inflammation of the fetal sac membranes. It is characterized by neutrophilic infiltration of the amnion and chorion.

A chronic and progressive lung disorder characterized by the loss of elasticity of the bronchial tree and the air sacs, destruction of the air sacs wall, thickening of the bronchial wall, and mucous accumulation in the bronchial tree. The pathologic changes result in the disruption of the air flow in the bronchial airways. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, wheezing, productive cough, and chest tightness. The two main types of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease are chronic obstructive bronchitis and emphysema.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Limping or lameness.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Pain, cramping, and fatigue of the lower extremities upon ambulation due to ischemia.
A procedure used to treat capsular contraction that uses physical manipulation of the breast to manually rupture scar tissue and release pressure on an implant.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Diffuse edema of the central region of the cornea, usually associated with the wearing of hard contact lenses, but may also occur in keratoconus.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Clouding of the middle area of the cornea, usually as a result of scarring due to Infection, injury, or inflammation.
A condition in which there is a deviation from or interruption of the normal coagulation properties of the blood.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Pertaining to or characterized by cognition. That operation of the mind which we become aware of objects of thought or perception; it includes all aspects of perceiving, thinking, or remembering.

CodeItem.nci_definition: Failure of a physiologic function or system.
A state of profound unconsciousness associated with markedly depressed cerebral activity. Causes include central nervous system damage, intoxication, and metabolic abnormalities.

A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of complete failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction to the ventricles. This is manifested on the ECG by disassociation of atrial and ventricular rhythms. The atrial rate must be faster than the ventricular rate. (CDISC)

CodeItem.fda_definition: A violent jar or shock, or the condition which results from such an injury.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A violent jar or shock, or the condition which results from such an injury.
A mental state characterized by a lack of clear and orderly thought and behavior.
Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.

Failure of the heart to pump a sufficient amount of blood to meet the needs of the body tissues, resulting in tissue congestion and edema. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, pitting edema, enlarged tender liver, engorged neck veins, and pulmonary rales.
Inflammation of the conjunctiva of the eye.
A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the connective tissue.
Irregular and infrequent or difficult evacuation of the bowels.

CodeItem.fda_definition: A bruise; an injury of a part without a break in the skin.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A bruise due to trauma.

CodeItem.fda_definition: A convulsion marked by alternating contracting and relaxing of the muscles.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A convulsion marked by alternating contracting and relaxing of the muscles.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Prolonged contraction of the muscles, as the result of an epileptic discharge.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Prolonged contraction of the muscles, as the result of an epileptic discharge.
A rupture in the corneal tissue due to traumatic or pathologic processes
Injury to the epithelium of the cornea.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Inability to maintain corneal integrity; or corneal edema resulting from failure of the corneal endothelium to maintain detumescence.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Endothelial decompensation that is manifested by opacity of the cornea. The condition often occurs as a nonspecific response to mechanical injury from incidental corneal contact by intraocular instruments during surgery; chemical injury from the improper use of intraocular drugs, drugs containing preservatives, or from residues from inadequate rinsing of detergents or other residues from surgical instruments. The most common causes of corneal endothelial decompensation in the adult population are cataract removal/IOL-related endothelial loss and Fuchs dystrophy. When severe, corneal endothelial decompensation requires corneal transplantation.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Hazy, swollen cornea.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Hazy, swollen cornea.
Opacity within the cornea.

CodeItem.fda_definition: Discrete, small lesions present in the cornea as a result of corneal inflammation and, in some cases, after soft contact lens wear especially extended-wear lenses.
